Legal_Issue: Whether the registrant proved use of the VISIBLE YOUTH trademark during the relevant period
Evidence_Assessment: Initial finding of insufficient evidence; new affidavits, sales records, invoices, and product images submitted as evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On registrant to show prima facie use of the trademark
Credibility_Factor: Bona fide sale sufficient to establish use
Legal_Rule: Prima facie evidence of use required under section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Standard_of_Review: Prima facie standard for trademark use
Procedural_Issue: New evidence presented to Federal Court on appeal
Outcome_on_Merits: Registrant proved use prior to assignment in August 2001
Key_Evidence_Considered: Sales records, invoices, product images bearing the mark, affidavits
Applicant_Challenge: Registrar's attempt to expunge for non-use
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence: invoices, sales records, product images, affidavits
Applicable_Process: Appeal process under Canadian trademark law
Governing_Rule: Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act requires proof of use
